Message: I'm really sorry you're feeling this way. If you are in crisis or need immediate help, please reach out to a mental health professional, a trusted person, or a helpline in your area. You are not alone, and there are people who care and want to support you.

If you are feeling suicidal or in immediate danger, please reach out for help immediately.  You can call your local emergency number (e.g., 911 in the US, 999 in the UK, 112 in Europe) or contact a suicide prevention hotline.  In the US, you can dial or text 988 (Suicide & Crisis Lifeline).  In the UK, you can call 111 (NHS) or 116 123 (Samaritans).  In India, you can call 022 2754 6669 (Vandrevala Foundation) or 091725 61760 (Aasra).  If you are in another country, please search for the specific helpline number for your location.
